conclusion: When the light source is moved to the back right, the position and size of the shadows A, B, C, and D will change.
Shadow A (Apple) will shift to the front left of the apple.
Shadow A (Apple) will become larger because the light is coming from a lower angle.
Shadow B (Flag) will be cast to the front left of the flag.
Shadow B (Flag) will become larger due to the lower angle of the light.
Shadow C (Glass) will move to the front left of the glass.
Shadow C (Glass) will increase in size.
Shadow D (Bone) will shift to the front left of the bone.
Shadow D (Bone) will become larger as the light source is lower.
In summary, all shadows will move towards the front left and increase in size when the light source is moved to the back right.
